document.title: Hawaiʻi Common Core Standards for English Language Arts

3997F06EF8644F4794B6A51283448B7F.description: Accurately use grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

F66CFB81D0A2429FA2CBFE2D5FBE4094.description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., stingy, scrimping, economical, unwasteful, thrifty).

9B1CC9C54DB64C6A8E124CDAD7E819AA.description: Use the relationship between particular words (e.g., cause/effect, part/whole, item/category) to better understand each of the words.

354430F9F2FE4CA9908BE64D17CC05D5.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., personification) in context.

CB40BF5FB93A4007826D2B0A77DB443C.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings:

DE40CAA7D384454F9C8A91CB89A2B2F2.description: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

5108D0E4E2DE4DC3A9FBFBAE14085007.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

568ABBCD15104733A83E236399C5117F.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

8DEFE141132B4AF785A3CDE9B8FAABEF.description: Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

C4F016FCBAD648BCBA7935FE22F37BA2.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 6 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies:

7326A62CE9D248FAB7D732921BEA3245.description: Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.

F7A1FBC295F84C76AA9D06AECBDB4FED.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing:

A5B61C4CC41649D0913B6C085C8B78DA.description: Use clear pronouns for unclear antecedents.

F1A6473E5F054EFDA1DF92AB7977F2B9.description: Use correct pronoun number and person.

B810E9BAD46741D19BAEED3BECBCA3C1.description: Use pronouns in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

F932A820E8044E6991763AF7F7F1BA09.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English grammar and usage when reading, writing, or speaking:

1A708012FFF84129BD5F3A48E70210F5.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts, demonstrating understanding of audience, task, and purpose, drawing on a full range of linguistic skills.

6F1F975105414274BD8FDD31F9BD329F.description: Present claims and findings, sequencing ideas logically and using pertinent descriptions, facts, and details to accentuate main ideas or themes; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

953383513ADA4C2FA736F01D97309C19.description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

229777A88079466D8A668AE716FD7669.description: Interpret information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and explain how it contributes to a topic, text, or issue under study.

65030A5CFE4645B4A13E2173354E57B9.description: Review the key ideas expressed and demonstrate understanding of multiple perspectives through reflection and paraphrasing.

255A911592884D10B8BCB730943AECE5.description: Pose and respond to specific questions with elaboration and detail by making comments that contribute to the topic, text, or issue under discussion.

84D3A3535B934A2C9D6312E9A8FA6396.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions, set specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

EB20E077FA4942589DED1200CE64736B.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

1B88C64DD5FA4B71BC22B5EE9A54A5E1.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacherled) with diverse partners on grade 6 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly:

D1C45A6B378F41659627CFC2046DA342.description: Provide basic bibliographic information for sources.

AB6A4623FD0F4452926EF5EE0A4B31F7.description: Quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism.

C6D51AEC4F974BB9BBC975E0DDDD2623.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

C73B30D72D5C41C59A0930007EE57659.description: Assess the credibility of each source.

AEE421D9A88E45999CB19FCD9E9A63D1.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources.

F8FC5B0709DD4B0485F95D97FDDE7642.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and modifying the inquiry when appropriate:

7A4E285B69BE4462B69122A32BADBCE9.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

BB70BAB8B8B44C5EA97E1506B56C4465.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of three pages in a single sitting.

A4BD0B4C9579484999C22A784C98EB85.description: With some guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of related Language standards.)

E7A47C3D73374666B44DF54024126CB0.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

2FE6B9138DF54B70B44699BF6541AF5C.description: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to convey experiences and events.

5CFCFBB07B0149E4BF73FB2A61515988.description: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence and signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another.

14354021E490409C8067BF75D126EA18.description: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, and description, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

92D2FFC91E874FED8DB6A79656113956.description: Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically.

EB792FC88BB046588BEF51EAD599DB57.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences:

36801918589E43F1A449FB2CB0494799.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the information or explanation presented.

69F835F0172B466F8690C0D722D8D76F.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

98853C2FBEE840D19E124B6463DCF735.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

CD433F3CB79E4E01BF2ED032B2FDEBC8.description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

2FC97F56EEAF444BB9C200ACA8510379.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

635C1B1519C64F8BB1CA8495ADABF2DB.description: Introduce a topic; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aid comprehension.

2604E33CCC4441868BBE786BDC9AD975.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content:

2590D9A5C21B4E658FC9143FE9540BE7.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the argument presented, as appropriate to the task.

EFEC43750589483A858C9EB9D2781B81.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

B60F7313E038494383D0A037C84D50A8.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to clarify the relationships among claim(s) and reasons.

450B42935FF749279A1D5055AA5C3CEE.description: Support claim(s) with clear reasons and relevant evidence, using credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

3B366BE85E68428CB815911237931847.description: Organize the reasons and evidence clearly.

936EA6922A9D4FD0BC0E034AA5A3DFCD.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence:

BFC00427846346728A42622E120F7B70.description: Read and comprehend literary texts appropriately complex for grade 6.

647090D7A9C9406081563B92AA2AFB78.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

0A438925499C462CB71410D9069EACBA.description: Compare and contrast texts in different forms or genres (e.g., stories and poems; historical novels and fantasy stories) in terms of their approaches to similar themes and topics.

AC9E0FEC968F4D34B0390E7BCCB26E94.description: Compare and contrast the experience of reading a story, drama, or poem to listening to or viewing an audio, video, or live version of the text, including contrasting what they “see” and “hear” when reading the text to what they perceive when they listen or watch.

A7448BA46CDB4AD68BE0FB0414A8C384.description: Explain how an author develops the perspective of the narrator or speaker in a text.

EB23345D94E8436DA9FDD66012739D1A.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, chapter, scene, or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the theme, setting, or plot.

6AC427FE1801410AA7BABD67148607C9.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

1239C9FA03C54DBE89FDF74134EAFF42.description: Describe how a particular story’s or drama’s plot unfolds in a series of episodes as well as how the characters respond or change as the plot moves toward a resolution.

87F84B0E1AEC4F329879311D41FCE62D.description: Incorporate a theme and story details into an objective summary of the text.

0077F44C9292450FB891A2AA731743B1.description: Determine a theme of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details.

288102A0FA884EECA95C9675492A7B69.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

8D26B681311B497DBAD998A6D8FDF974.description: Read and comprehend informational texts appropriately complex for grade 6.

3F6F3BD823304CDC8B5C221F6D22DD7E.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

B03116965621492BA35BCEF3DCB667EC.description: Compare and contrast one author’s presentation of events with that of another (e.g., a memoir written by and a biography on the same person).

A76DE875170047D0871151B81D288559.description: Trace and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, distinguishing claims that are supported by reasons and evidence from claims that are not.

8448C5997FB944349FCE311FEB7B4EE5.description: Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

345D937D9B7D497AB8469CCA92EBA08E.description: Determine an author’s point of view/perspective or purpose in a text and explain how it is conveyed in the text.

885F77D3DD4E4ACCAB95FE26C3CA869D.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

66BF980CBD3C4F7EA76B1E8B4074A6FB.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

EA2D42DEA7854A91BE9DC8FE25C817B3.description: Analyze in detail how a key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, and elaborated in a text (e.g., through examples or anecdotes).

F1039E4BF8D0455D9D01A2AEE2BD04B8.description: Incorporate key details that convey the main/central idea into an objective summary of the text.

C9365015EACC40F9AAB1ABD7D788BD7B.description: Determine a main/central idea of a text.

E85F36B30D6B4881A0C2BDD479A95B3A.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

8BE0FDAD8DA84259A4409DB87EBAE0F9.description: Read grade-level text orally with fluency (accuracy, automaticity, and prosody) to support comprehension, in accordance with grade-level fluency norms.
